question: Which of the following incidents apparently “kills” Grandma in “I Sing the Body Electric!”?

b: Agatha is confused between her distaste for her mother and her grief.
c: Agatha finds it difficult to accept that her mother was not a good person.
d: Agatha is filled with resentment because her mother “left” her with no explanation.
e: Agatha was smothered by her mother, but misses her now that she’s gone.

question: In “I Sing the Body Electric!”, Grandma says she can be sent to
a: a quarry where her parts will be used to build other robots
b: a room where she can socialize with other robots
c: a resort where she can peacefully retire from her job as caretaker
d: a house with more children for her to take care of
e: a factory where she can be improved and refined
